Class ToolBox

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
javax.swing.JComponent
javax.swing.JPanel
taskmanagement.ui.util.RoundedPanel
taskmanagement.ui.widgets.ToolBox
All Implemented Interfaces:
ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, Accessible
public final class ToolBox extends RoundedPanel
A right-side toolbox composed of six sections (Undo/Redo, Advance/Mark, Sort, Filter, Counters, Export).

This view delegates user actions to TasksViewAPI (MVVM). It exposes wiring helpers to bind selection, sorting strategies, filters (Combinator), and exporting behavior.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • ToolBox

      public ToolBox()
      Creates the toolbox panel with all six sections and placeholder wiring.

  • Method Details

    • wireTo

      public void wireTo(TasksViewAPI api, ToolBox.IdsProvider idsProvider, Function<String, SortStrategy> sortMapper, Supplier<ITaskFilter> filterSupplier, ToolBox.ExportHandler exportHandler, Property<int[]> selectionProperty)
      Full binding helper (actions, counters, filters, export).
      Parameters:
      api - the UI-facing API
      idsProvider - provider for selected task IDs
      sortMapper - mapping from combo text to a SortStrategy
      filterSupplier - supplier for composed ITaskFilter
      exportHandler - handler that performs export
      selectionProperty - observable selection property

    • setApi

      public void setApi(TasksViewAPI api)
      Binds the API and wires safe default actions (undo/redo and filter reset).
      Parameters:
      api - the TasksViewAPI to use
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if api is null

    • setIdsProvider

      public void setIdsProvider(ToolBox.IdsProvider idsProvider)
      Sets the provider used to obtain currently selected task IDs.
      Parameters:
      idsProvider - provider returning selected IDs
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if idsProvider is null

    • bindSortControls

      public void bindSortControls(List<SortStrategy> strategies)
      Populates the sort combo and wires Apply/Reset using the first entry as the default.
      Parameters:
      strategies - strategies to expose
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if strategies is null

    • setSortMapper

      public void setSortMapper(Function<String, SortStrategy> sortMapper)
      Sets a mapper from combo text to SortStrategy and wires the buttons.
      Parameters:
      sortMapper - mapping function
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if sortMapper is null

    • setFilterSupplier

      public void setFilterSupplier(Supplier<ITaskFilter> filterSupplier)
      Sets the supplier used to produce a composed ITaskFilter for Apply.
      Parameters:
      filterSupplier - filter supplier
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if filterSupplier is null

    • bindFilterControls

      public void bindFilterControls(TasksViewAPI api)
      Binds the Filter UI directly to the API (Apply/Reset/Toggle).
      Parameters:
      api - the TasksViewAPI to bind
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if api is null

    • setExportHandler

      public void setExportHandler(ToolBox.ExportHandler exportHandler)
      Sets a custom export handler. If not set, a dialog-based export is used.
      Parameters:
      exportHandler - handler to execute export
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if exportHandler is null

    • bindSelectionProperty

      public void bindSelectionProperty(Property<int[]> selectionProperty)
      Binds selection property for counters and enables/disables actions accordingly.
      Parameters:
      selectionProperty - observable selection property (IDs)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if selectionProperty is null

    • bindTotalsFromApi

      public void bindTotalsFromApi()
      Subscribes to tasks and filtered-tasks to keep the Total counter in sync. Safe to call multiple times; replaces previous listeners.

    • bindAdvanceAndMarkDialogs

      public void bindAdvanceAndMarkDialogs()
      Replaces placeholders for Advance/Mark-as with real dialogs and VM calls.

    • updateCounters

      public void updateCounters(int selected, int total)
      Updates counters text. Typically invoked automatically via bindings.
      Parameters:
      selected - number of selected tasks (non-negative)
      total - total number of tasks (non-negative)
